content:
One of the most bright engineers was born!

Oh! Wait! That was me?

where: Miguel de Unamuno High School, Bilbao, Spain
content:
Meanwhile was doing the first years of my bachelor, I was helping as a teacher in my old high school. They call it "La escuela de deberes" which means the school of homeworks. It was a program promoted by the basque goverment in which we, as old students of that high school, help younger generations with their homework, completely free for them.

It was a nice human and relational experience.

I have done my bachelor degree in Computer Engineering at the University of Deusto, Bilbao. It was the first approach to the computing world, though I've always had an interest on it.

The initial knowledge in my career.

where: Deustotech Research Centre (Mobility department), Bilbao, Spain
content:
Since the third year of my bachelor, I started working with a part-time job at the research centre of the University of Deusto: Deustotech. There is where I started doing different projects oriented to research and, also my final grade project: Trip2Bilbao.

The first approach in the labour market, having a team and a boss.

After finishing my bachelor and considering that they offer me to continue at the research centre as graduate, I decided to do a master degree in the same university, combining both things. It was a really nice experience to complete my education and it enriched me personally.

where: Deustotech Research Centre (Mobility department), Bilbao, Spain
content:
With my bachelor degree finished, Deustotech centre offer me to continue as a full-time employee, though decided to complete my education with a master. That's why I have been working as a part-time job meanwhile I was studying.

During this period, I had the opportunity to work in two different projects: GIVARAIL and eFleet.

During the master degree, there was a possibility of doing an internship or an Erasmus program abroad. Initially, I had an opportunity to go to Munich for 6 months to a aerospacial research centre, but I also applied for an oportunity at CERN in Switzerland. For my surprise, I was selected for going there.

In this place I had the oppotunity to work on the ALICE detector in the DCS (Data Control Systems) group. The project I worked on was ADAPOS (using DIM, WINCC OA, 0MQ and C++), that can be seen in the project tab.

Key member on the OPS team, developing Warehouse management innovative systems.

Working on systems using Vert.x, Groovy, Angular 4, Vue.js, Redis and AWS. Migrating systems to Java 11 with SpringBoot and RabbitMQ. Using CQRS, DDD, TDD and Hexagonal Architecture.

Working as Tech Lead/Engineering Manager on Warehouse Operations systems (OPS).

Nevertheless, supporting the team on the current development of our milestones, using Java 17, RabbitMQ, SpringBoot, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and other technologies. Consequently, acting as Software Engineer too.

Migrating Python (Django) services to microservices implemented in Kotlin, Dynamodb, SAS and AWS Lambdas

Using: Kotlin, Python, Springboot, gRPC, pySOA, DynamoDB / MySQL, Datadog, Cloudwatch, Splunk, CircleCI, CDK and more!

It could be here or there, you or not you, that company or another company... The future is unclear, but this milestone could be related with you in some level :).

Make it happen!
